edu.wm.cs.cs301.cullenrombach.falstad

Class BasicRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wm.cs.cs301.cullenrombach.falstad.BasicRobot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Robot

    public class BasicRobot
extends java.lang.Object
implements Robot
    Responsibilities: This class contains the methods necessary to operates a robot that is inside a maze at a particular location and looking in a particular direction. Collaborators: a Maze class to be explored, a RobotDriver class that operates the BasicRobot, and a Cells class for checking characteristics about the maze cell the robot is in.
    Author:
    Cullen Rombach (cmromb)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface edu.wm.cs.cs301.cullenrombach.falstad.Robot

        Robot.Direction, Robot.Turn

      • BasicRobot

        public BasicRobot()
        The default constructor for a new BasicRobot object. Sets up the robot's sensors and fields.

      • BasicRobot

        public BasicRobot(Maze maze)
        Constructs a new BasicRobot object and sets up its sensors and fields. This constructor also sets the Maze the robot will operate on.
        Parameters:
        maze - is the Maze this robot will operate on.

    • Method Detail

      • rotate

        public void rotate(Robot.Turn turn)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Rotates the robot, LEFT, RIGHT, or AROUND.
        Specified by:
        rotate in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        turn - is the direction the robot will rotate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the robot stops for lack of energy.

      • move

        public void move(int distance)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Moves robot forward a given number of steps. If the robot runs out of energy somewhere on its way, it stops. If the robot hits an obstacle like a wall, it remains at the position in front of the obstacle but hasStopped() == false.
        Specified by:
        move in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        distance - is the number of cells to move in the robot's current forward direction
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if robot hits an obstacle like a wall or border, which indicates that current position is not as expected. Also thrown if robot runs out of energy.

      • getCurrentPosition

        public int[] getCurrentPosition()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Provides the current position as (x,y) coordinates for the maze cell as an array of length 2 with [x,y].
        Specified by:
        getCurrentPosition in interface Robot
        Returns:
        array of length 2, x = array[0], y = array[1]
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if position is outside of the maze

      • setMaze

        public void setMaze(Maze maze)
        Stores the given maze as the maze this robot will operate on. The maze serves as the main source of information about the current location, the presence of walls, the reaching of an exit.
        Specified by:
        setMaze in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        maze - is the current maze

      • isAtGoal

        public boolean isAtGoal()
        Tells if current position is at the goal (the exit). Used to recognize termination of a search.
        Specified by:
        isAtGoal in interface Robot
        Returns:
        true if robot is at the goal, false otherwise

      • canSeeGoal

        public boolean canSeeGoal(Robot.Direction direction)
                   throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Tells if a sensor can identify the goal in given direction relative to the robot's current forward direction from the current position.
        Specified by:
        canSeeGoal in interface Robot
        Returns:
        true if the goal (here: exit of the maze) is visible in a straight line of sight, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if robot has no sensor in this direction

      • isInsideRoom

        public boolean isInsideRoom()
                     throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Tells if current position is inside a room.
        Specified by:
        isInsideRoom in interface Robot
        Returns:
        true if robot is inside a room, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if not supported by robot

      • hasRoomSensor

        public boolean hasRoomSensor()
        Tells if the robot has a room sensor (true if yes, false if no).
        Specified by:
        hasRoomSensor in interface Robot

      • getCurrentDirection

        public int[] getCurrentDirection()
        Provides the current direction as (dx,dy) values for the robot as an array of length 2 with [dx,dy]. Note that dx,dy are elements of {-1,0,1} and as in bitmasks masks in Cells.java and dirsx,dirsy in MazeBuilder.java.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentDirection in interface Robot
        Returns:
        array of length 2, dx = array[0], dy=array[1]

      • getBatteryLevel

        public float getBatteryLevel()
        Returns the current battery level. If battery level <= 0 then robot stops to function and hasStopped() is true.
        Specified by:
        getBatteryLevel in interface Robot
        Returns:
        current battery level, level is > 0 if operational.

      • setBatteryLevel

        public void setBatteryLevel(float level)
        Sets the current battery level. If battery level <= 0 then robot stops to function and hasStopped() is true.
        Specified by:
        setBatteryLevel in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        level - is the current battery level

      • getEnergyForFullRotation

        public float getEnergyForFullRotation()
        Gives the energy consumption for a full 360 degree rotation. Scaling by other degrees approximates the corresponding consumption.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyForFullRotation in interface Robot
        Returns:
        energy for a full rotation

      • getEnergyForStepForward

        public float getEnergyForStepForward()
        Gives the energy consumption for moving forward for a distance of 1 step. For simplicity, we assume that this equals the energy necessary to move 1 step backwards and that scaling by a larger number of moves is approximately the corresponding multiple.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyForStepForward in interface Robot
        Returns:
        energy for a single step forward

      • hasStopped

        public boolean hasStopped()
        Tells if the robot has stopped for reasons like lack of energy, hitting an obstacle, etc.
        Specified by:
        hasStopped in interface Robot
        Returns:
        true if the robot has stopped, false otherwise

      • distanceToObstacle

        public int distanceToObstacle(Robot.Direction direction)
                       throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Tells the distance to an obstacle (a wall or border) in a direction as given and relative to the robot's current forward direction. Distance is measured in the number of cells towards that obstacle, e.g. 0 if current cell has a wall in this direction
        Specified by:
        distanceToObstacle in interface Robot
        Returns:
        number of steps towards obstacle if obstacle is visible in a straight line of sight, Integer.MAX_VALUE otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if not supported by robot

      • hasDistanceSensor

        public boolean hasDistanceSensor(Robot.Direction direction)
        Tells if the robot has a distance sensor for the given direction.
        Specified by:
        hasDistanceSensor in interface Robot
        Returns:
        true if yes, false otherwise.
